name: Delft
fun_fact: Fun fact: Delft Blue pottery has been handcrafted using traditional methods for over 360 years at Royal Delft (Koninklijke Porceleyne Fles), the last remaining Delftware factory from 1653‚Äîand the iconic blue-and-white ceramics are so beloved that KLM airline fills miniature Delft Blue houses with jenever to give passengers!

hero_dishes.name: Stroopwafel
hero_dishes.description: Two thin crispy waffle cookies sandwiching caramel syrup filling, served fresh and warm
hero_dishes.origin_story: The quintessential Dutch treat, best enjoyed fresh from market stalls where they're made on griddles. When placed over a hot coffee cup, the steam warms the caramel, creating the perfect texture. A symbol of Dutch street food culture.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Markt Square Thursday market (lively market with fresh stroopwafels), local caf√©s throughout historic center

hero_dishes.name: Broodje Kroket
hero_dishes.description: Crispy deep-fried meat ragout croquette served in a soft bun
hero_dishes.origin_story: A beloved Dutch comfort food combining crispy exterior with creamy meat filling. Represents Dutch 'gezelligheid' (coziness) and casual dining culture. The ultimate satisfying street food.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Caf√©s and snack bars throughout Delft, Markt Square establishments

hero_dishes.name: Dutch Pancakes (Pannenkoeken)

hero_dishes.origin_story: Traditional Dutch meal served for lunch or dinner, not just breakfast. Can be topped with bacon and cheese or apple and cinnamon, representing Dutch versatility and comfort food traditions.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Het Konings Huys (exquisite Dutch cuisine where culinary artistry meets historical charm), Bij Harry (authentic Dutch where tradition meets modernity), Moeke Delft (tradition meets modern taste)

signature_drinks.name: Jenever (Dutch Gin)
signature_drinks.description: Traditional Dutch spirit with maltier, slightly sweeter flavor than gin, considered the grandfather of gin
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Delft is one of the historic 'jenever cities' (jeneversteden) famous since the 16th century. Served in tulip-shaped glass filled to the brim (surface tension makes it rise above the rim). Jonge jenever served at room temperature, sometimes with sugar and tiny spoon. 'Kopstoot' (headbutt) ritual: jenever alongside beer as chaser. 'Duikboot' (submarine): jenever glass dipped into beer. UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage status. KLM fills miniature Delft Blue house replicas with jenever for passengers!

signature_drinks.name: Koffie Verkeerd
signature_drinks.description: Dutch 'wrong coffee'‚Äîequal parts coffee and warm milk, similar to latte
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: A smooth, comforting drink beloved in Netherlands caf√© culture. Though many Dutch prefer straight black coffee (strong, simple, no fuss), Koffie Verkeerd offers a gentler option. Perfect for leisurely caf√© sessions and people-watching on Delft's picturesque canals.

signature_drinks.name: Dutch Coffee
signature_drinks.description: Coffee combined with jenever and topped with whipped cream
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: A luxurious, comforting beverage showcasing Dutch innovation in combining traditional spirits with everyday drinks. Perfect for sipping on chilly evenings.

food_culture_notes: Delft is one of the historic 'jenever cities' alongside Schiedam, Groningen, and Amsterdam
During Dutch Golden Age (17th century), Delft became an important brewery city
Markt Square hosts Thursday market where locals sample delicacies, browse flowers, and soak up authentic Dutch atmosphere
Caf√© culture centers on 'gezelligheid'‚Äîcozy conviviality with coffee, sweets, and conversation
Delft Blue pottery tradition intersects with drinking culture (KLM jenever houses)
Restaurant scene blends traditional Dutch cuisine with international influences
Royal Delft factory (360+ years old) is the only remaining original Delftware producer
Delft is the birthplace of Johannes Vermeer ('Girl with a Pearl Earring' painter)
Advocaat (sweet creamy egg liqueur) is another Dutch specialty
Chocomel (rich Dutch hot chocolate) is popular year-round, hot in winter or chilled
